meanings.definition: The crime of forcing another person to have sexual intercourse without their consent.
meanings.sent1: The news reported a terrible rape in the city last night.
meanings.sent2: She bravely testified against her rapist in court.
meanings.sent3: The detective solved the case of the missing cookie - it was a cookie rape!
meanings.sent4: The storm seemed to rape the land, leaving destruction in its wake.
meanings.sent5: The documentary shed light on the devastating impact of rape on survivors.

meanings.definition: To seize and take away by force.
meanings.sent1: The bandits attempted to rape the treasure from the castle.
meanings.sent2: He managed to rape the ball from the opponent and score a goal.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous squirrel tried to rape the acorns from the bird feeder.
meanings.sent4: The strong winds seemed to rape the leaves from the trees.
meanings.sent5: The bully tried to rape the lunch money from the younger students.

meanings.sent1: The invaders sought to rape the village of its riches.
meanings.sent2: The pirates would often rape ships along the coast.
meanings.sent3: The kids playfully pretended to rape the candy jar after dinner.
meanings.sent4: The tornado appeared to rape the fields, leaving nothing behind.
meanings.sent5: The vandals attempted to rape the park of its beauty by spray painting graffiti everywhere.
